hunt for a “BibTeX citation” button or manually copy and paste formatted citations.

title: Impromptu Bibtex Find and Merge Tool
text:
Script Overview
-this bash script automates the process of extracting BibTeX citations from arbitrary web pages, streamlining the workflow for researchers.
-The script avoids manual efforts such as hunting for a BibTeX citation button or copying formatted citations.

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Generate data
x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

# Plot the data
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title("Sine Wave Plot")
plt.xlabel("X-axis")
plt.ylabel("Y-axis")
plt.show()

title: Impromptu BibTeX Find and Merge Tool
text:
-The Impromptu BibTeX Find and Merge Tool, developed by MJ Marchywka, is a Bash script designed to scrape BibTeX entries from arbitrary web pages. -This tool simplifies the process of gathering citations by automating the detection of BibTeX entries for citation management (Marchywka 2021).

“A tool that simplifies BibTeX citation management can significantly enhance research efficiency.” — Anonymous Researcher



Here are the primary charactrstics of the Impromptu BibTeX Find and Merge Tool:

Automatic Detection: The tool automatically finds BibTeX citations on webpages.
Customizable Scraping: Users can modify the scraping parameters to suit their needs.



Manual BibTeX Entry: Finding and copying is time-consuming.

Automated BibTeX Entry: The tool automates BibTeX citation retrieval and merging.





The following table outlines the typical workflow of the Impromptu BibTeX Find and Merge Tool:



Step
Description




1. Web Scraping
Automatically detects BibTeX citations on pages.


2. Data Extraction
Extracts relevant BibTeX data.


3. Data Merging
Merges BibTeX entries into a single file.


4. Final Output
Outputs a consolidated BibTeX file.






The time saved can be quantified using an optimization formula for time efficiency:
\[
T_{\text{manual}} - T_{\text{automated}} = \Delta T_{\text{saved}}
\] Where: - \(T_{\text{manual}}\) is the time taken to manually collect citations. - \(T_{\text{automated}}\) is the time taken using the automated tool. - \(\Delta T_{\text{saved}}\) is the net time saved.
Here is a sentence that references a footnote[^1]. [^1]:Ihis can lead to significant time savings in large research projects.



-Relationship to other tools and efforts -Examples: TOOBIB and MED2BIB 
 ## Video about
Below is a video demonstration that shows how to generate references with LaTeX and BibTeX:





Below is a flowchart illustrating the process flow of the Impromptu BibTeX Find and Merge Tool:

B{BibTeX Found?}; B –>|Yes| C[Extract Data]; B –>|No| D[End Process]; C –> E[Merge Entries]; E –> F[Generate BibTeX File];
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Impromptu Bibtex Find and Merge Tool

Script Overview


As described by (Marchywka 2021), this bash script automates the process of extracting BibTeX citations from arbitrary web pages.
The script avoids manual efforts such as hunting for a BibTeX citation button or copying formatted citations.
